objective: To verify if the provided medical device technical documentation contains information pertaining to key regulatory and quality aspects. For each point, the goal is to identify relevant passage(s) (citation/quotation) from the document and assess the level of information coverage (e.g., Fully Covered, Partially Covered, Not Covered, Not Clear).

items.title: Device Identification & Manufacturer
questions: Is the device clearly identified by its official name(s) (e.g., trade name, model numbers)?
Is the legal manufacturer and their address clearly stated?

items.title: Intended Use / Indications for Use
questions: Is the specific medical purpose and the clinical conditions for which the device is intended clearly defined?
Is the target patient population (e.g., adult, pediatric, specific conditions) described?

items.title: Contraindications
questions: Are there explicit statements about situations, conditions, or patient groups for whom the device must NOT be used?

items.title: Device Description & Principles of Operation
questions: Does the document provide a comprehensive description of the device, its main components/materials, and its accessories?
Is the scientific or technical principle by which the device achieves its intended purpose explained?

items.title: Potential Risks & Adverse Events
questions: Is there a list or discussion of known or foreseeable risks, side effects, or potential adverse events associated with the device's use?

items.title: Risk Management Summary
questions: Is there evidence or a statement that a systematic risk management process (e.g., aligned with ISO 14971) was applied throughout the device lifecycle?

items.title: Preclinical Evaluation Summary (Non-Clinical Testing)
questions: Does the documentation summarize key non-clinical tests performed to ensure safety and performance (e.g., biocompatibility, electrical safety, mechanical integrity, software verification, sterilization validation, shelf-life)?
Are references to applicable standards (e.g., ISO, IEC, ASTM) for these tests mentioned?

items.title: Animal Studies (if applicable)
questions: If animal studies were necessary and performed, is there a summary of these studies, their objectives, and key findings related to safety or performance?

items.title: Clinical Evaluation & Performance Data
questions: Is there a summary of the clinical evidence supporting the device's safety and performance for its intended use?
Are key clinical outcome measures, study designs, patient numbers, and results (both safety and effectiveness) presented or summarized?

items.title: MRI Safety Information (if applicable to the device type)
questions: If the device could be exposed to an MRI environment, are specific conditions for safe MRI use (MR Conditional) or contraindications (MR Unsafe) clearly stated?

items.title: Human Factors / Usability Engineering
questions: Is there mention or evidence of a usability engineering process being applied to optimize the device's user interface and minimize use-related hazards?

items.title: Information Supplied to the User (Labeling & IFU Content)
questions: Does the documentation describe or reflect the core content that would be provided to the end-user, such as essential elements of labeling and Instructions For Use?
Are key warnings, precautions, and instructions for proper use, storage, and maintenance adequately covered or described?

items.title: Sterilization & Packaging (for sterile devices)
questions: If the device is supplied sterile, is the method of sterilization described or referenced?
Is information on the sterile barrier system and maintenance of sterility provided or summarized?

items.title: Software Lifecycle Processes (for devices with software/firmware)
questions: If the device incorporates software or is controlled by software, is there evidence of systematic software development, verification, and validation processes (e.g., aligned with IEC 62304)?

items.title: Post-Market Surveillance (PMS) & Vigilance Concepts
questions: Is there an indication of the manufacturer's framework or commitment to post-market surveillance and procedures for handling and reporting adverse events (vigilance)?
